title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. 62

C. 65

D. 70

---

2. Elon Musk said that he had lined up financing for his $46.5 billion offer to buy Twitter, including debt commitments from which of these banks?

A. Goldman Sachs

B. JP Morgan

C. Morgan Stanley

D. Barclays

---

3. Many people see trouble coming between May 10 and June 2. Why?

A. A crucial wave of oil futures will expire.

B. A massive series of Russian bonds will come due.

C. Many central banks, including the Fed, have meetings scheduled.

D. It's the next Mercury retrograde.

---

4. Tycoon William Hockey and his wife Annie bought a bricks-and-mortar bank for their fintech startup. Which one?

A. Presidio Savings

B. Northern California National

C. Southern California National

D. Bailey Building & Loan

---

5. Bill Bengen originated the idea that, in retirement, you can spend 4% of your savings annually, adjusted for inflation. What does he say now?

A. "Head for the hills!"

B. Take less until we can tell if inflation is here to stay.

C. Take more because inflation will send asset prices soaring.

D. Postpone retirement because future investment returns will be scant.

---

6. BeReal is making inroads among the young. What is it?

A. An online evangelical church

B. A social media app that demands photos at random times

C. A cognitive behavioral therapy app

D. A Gibraltar tradition making random citizens monarch for a day

---

7. U.S. District Judge Kathryn Kimball Mizelle threw out the federal Covid-19 mask requirement for public transportation. Where is her courtroom?

A. Atlanta

B. Dallas

C. New Orleans

D. Tampa

---

ANSWERS

1. C

2. C

3. D

4. B

5. B

6. B

7. D
